cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) because it deals with document summarisation, which is a common task in NLP. It also uses Reinforcement Learning (RL) algorithms, which are commonly used in NLP research. 

It could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category because document summarisation is a task related to information retrieval. 

The paper's focus on learning a reward function using Learning-to-Rank (L2R) algorithms suggests that it could belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. 

The use of RL algorithms also suggests that it could belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper's focus on efficient RL algorithms suggests that it could belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
